channel.title: China: Policy and perspective
channel.description:
A series of talks from the University of Chicago dealing with current events in China.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: China's foreign policy, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, features a lecture on Chinese foreign policy by David Mozingo of Cornell University.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: China's nuclear capability
item.description: This program features a lecture by Albert Wohlstetter of the University of Chicago.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Salient aspects of China's history
item.description: This program features a lecture by Chinese-American historian Ping-ti Ho of the University of Chicago.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: China's foreign policy, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, features a lecture on Chinese foreign policy by David Mozingo of Cornell University.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Leadership crisis in China
item.description: This program features a lecture by John Wilson Lewis, an expert on Chinese politics.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Cultural Revolution
item.description: This program features a lecture by Tang Tsou of the University of Chicago.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: China's military capability
item.description: This program features a lecture by Frank Armbruster of the Hudson Institute.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: China, U.S. and the Soviet Union
item.description: This program features a lecture by Donald Zagoria of Columbia University.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics
